intro: Rhododendron pauciflorum var. calocodon, commonly known as the Calocodon rhododendron, is a flowering shrub native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters, preferring well-drained, acidic soils. Its botanical features include small, leathery leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that attract pollinators. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and conservation areas.
